condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: Increasing attacks and loses in lives of humanitarian workers, children and community members and aid agencies undermined needed response to humanitarian situations. COVID-19 pandemic imposed reconfiguration of program and operational strategies. In the North-West/South-West, 60,000 people were newly displaced. In Far-North region, children and communities continued to be traumatized by Boko Haram attacks with an increase in killings, rape, looting and abduction. Country-wide, 78 of 189 health districts (8/10 regions) are in measles epidemic stage. Only 20% of the Humanitarian Action Plan funding needs have been met. This is impacting on both response quality and coverage. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2020
